info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 7:44PM CDT until May 06 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN COMANCHE...NORTHWESTERN COTTON...SOUTH CENTRAL KIOWA AND NORTHEASTERN TILLMAN COUNTIES... At 743 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Chattanooga, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters ping pong hail 2 miles north of Hollister. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Cache, Chattanooga, Indiahoma, Manitou, Faxon, southwestern Fort Sill, and southwestern Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
